Summary As consumers, students, parents and employees, you have seen the way technology has transformed the way we find information and learn. We experience it every day with tools like Google Search, Gmail, Chrome and many other technologies that have changed the way we live, learn and collaborate. 
 
If you give kids the web, they never stop learning. When the web is open and tools affordable, it evens the playing field in education. Learning should be accessible beyond the classroom: for anyone, from any device, anywhere. Learning should be a collaborative experience that inspires lifelong curiosity. Transforming education today better prepares students for the modern world. 
 
Technology alone does not transform education. It takes a collaborative effort from everyone involved. Whether you’re a student, a teacher, a school administrator, a parent or policy-maker, we all play a part in this journey to transform the way students learn and thrive, from kindergarten all the way through university. 
 
My name is Richard Achée, and I work with strategic partners in Google for Education. The mission of Google for Education is to help transform education by providing open technology that improves learning for everyone, everywhere. 
 
For over 16 years, I have been working with organisations around the world to help them use technology to become more collaborative, creative, and innovative. 
 
As you can tell, I am passionate about bringing the power of Google technology to K-12 education. So, if you are interested in learning how Google is helping schools transform education in the US and around the world, I’d be happy to discuss multiple case studies of client successes, and share insights that can help your organisation. 
 
Specialties:Education Technology, Chromebook. Summary I am currently a Business Development Manager at Google focused on developing the SMB segment across Sub-saharan Africa. I have over 10 years experience spanning various functions including business development, strategy, marketing, branding, finance and corporate governance. I have also worked across across various sectors / industries including technology, finance, retail, media, real estate, infrastructure and public sector. Prior to joining Google in 2011, I worked for consulting company, Accenture as a Strategy consultant and prior to that, I worked with leading Nigerian entrepreneurs one of which is the Silverbird Group. I am passionate about the SMB segment as well as growing world-class local enterprenuers. In my spare time, I mentor young startups. I have a bachelor's degree in Computer Science from the University of Lagos and a Masters in Management and Strategic Information Systems from the University of Bath, United Kingdom.
